panels.description: Real-time GPS tracking map showing the device's current location and movement trail. GPS coordinates are derived from NMEA sentences (GPGGA/GPRMC) transmitted by GL.iNet GL-X3000 Spitz or GL-XE3000 Puli routers. Colors show temporal progression from newer (green) to older (red) GPS points.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "latitude" or r._field == "longitude")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 30s, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> pivot(rowKey:["_time"], columnKey: ["_field"], valueColumn: "_value")
  |> map(fn: (r) => ({ r with time_value: uint(v: r._time) }))
  |> keep(columns: ["_time", "latitude", "longitude", "time_value"])
  |> sort(columns: ["_time"])

panels.title: GPS Location Map

panels.description: Altitude above mean sea level in meters. This data comes from the GPS receiver's calculation based on satellite signals and may differ from barometric altitude.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "altitude")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Altitude Above Sea Level

panels.description: Speed over ground in Miles Per Hour (MPH). Calculated from GPRMC NMEA sentences which provide speed in knots, then converted to MPH.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "speed_mph")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Speed (MPH)

panels.description: Speed over ground in Kilometers Per Hour (KM/H). Calculated from GPRMC NMEA sentences which provide speed in knots, then converted to KM/H.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "speed_kmh")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Speed (KM/H)

panels.description: Number of GPS satellites currently being tracked by the receiver. More satellites generally mean better position accuracy. Minimum 4 satellites needed for 3D positioning.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "satellites")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Satellites Tracked

panels.description: GPS fix quality indicator: 0=Invalid, 1=GPS Fix (SPS), 2=DGPS Fix, 3=PPS Fix, 4=Real Time Kinematic, 5=Float RTK, 6=Dead reckoning, 7=Manual input, 8=Simulation mode

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "fix_quality")
  |> last()

panels.title: GPS Fix Quality

panels.description: Horizontal Dilution of Precision (HDOP) indicates GPS accuracy. Lower values mean better accuracy: <1=Ideal, 1-2=Excellent, 2-5=Good, 5-10=Moderate, 10-20=Fair, >20=Poor

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "hdop")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Horizontal Dilution of Precision (HDOP)

panels.description: Course over ground in degrees (0-360°). This is the actual direction of movement, which may differ from the vehicle's heading due to factors like wind or current.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "course")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Course Over Ground

panels.description: Speed in nautical knots as reported directly from GPRMC NMEA sentences. 1 knot = 1.852 km/h = 1.15078 mph.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "speed_knots")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Speed (Knots)

panels.description: Current GPS time from the satellite constellation. Shows the exact timestamp when GPS position was calculated.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "gps_time")
  |> last()

panels.title: GPS Time

panels.description: Shows which NMEA sentence type was the source of the latest GPS data (GPGGA for position/altitude, GPRMC for speed/course).

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_position")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "source_sentence")
  |> last()

panels.title: Data Source

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - Total number of satellites visible to the GPS receiver from GPGSV sentences. This includes satellites that may not be actively used for positioning. Higher numbers generally indicate better satellite coverage but don't directly affect position accuracy. Useful for diagnosing GPS reception issues in urban canyons or under tree cover.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "satellite_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "satellites_in_view")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Satellites in View (GPGSV)

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - Complete Dilution of Precision (DOP) metrics from GPGSA sentences. PDOP (Position DOP) affects 3D position accuracy, HDOP (Horizontal DOP) affects lat/lon accuracy, VDOP (Vertical DOP) affects altitude accuracy. Lower values indicate better precision. Values <2 are excellent, 2-5 good, >10 poor. These are more detailed than the basic HDOP from GPGGA sentences.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_dop_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "pdop" or r._field == "hdop" or r._field == "vdop")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Dilution of Precision (GPGSA)

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - GPS fix type from GPGSA sentences: 1=No fix, 2=2D fix (lat/lon only), 3=3D fix (lat/lon/altitude). This is similar to but may differ slightly from the fix quality in GPGGA sentences. Useful for diagnosing GPS performance and understanding when altitude data is reliable.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_dop_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "fix_type")
  |> last()

panels.title: GPS Fix Type (GPGSA)

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - Number of satellites actively used for position calculation from GPGSA sentences. This differs from 'satellites in view' as it only counts satellites actually contributing to the position fix. Should be 4+ for 3D positioning. Useful for understanding GPS performance quality.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_dop_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "active_satellites_count")
  |> last()

panels.title: Active Satellites (GPGSA)

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - GPS mode from GPGSA sentences: A=Automatic satellite selection, M=Manual satellite selection. This technical detail shows how the GPS receiver is configured to select satellites for positioning. Rarely useful for tracking applications but included for completeness.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_dop_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "mode")
  |> last()

panels.title: GPS Mode (GPGSA)

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - Redundant navigation data from GPVTG sentences. True Track shows course over ground relative to true north, Magnetic Track shows course relative to magnetic north. The difference between them indicates magnetic declination. This data duplicates course information from GPRMC but provides both true and magnetic references.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_navigation_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "true_track_degrees" or r._field == "magnetic_track_degrees")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Track Made Good (GPVTG)

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - Redundant speed data from GPVTG sentences showing speed in both knots and km/h. This duplicates the speed information already available from GPRMC sentences but provides it in different units for validation. Useful for cross-checking speed measurements or when precise unit conversions are needed.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_navigation_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "speed_knots" or r._field == "speed_kmh")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.title: Redundant Speed Data (GPVTG)

panels.description: **AUXILIARY DATA (Low Priority)** - FAA mode indicator from GPVTG sentences showing GPS positioning mode: A=Autonomous, D=Differential, E=Estimated, M=Manual, S=Simulator, N=Data Not Valid, P=Precise. This technical detail shows the operating mode of the GPS receiver. Rarely changes during normal operation but useful for diagnosing GPS system behavior.

targets.query:
from(bucket: "gps_data")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._measurement == "gps_navigation_data")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._field == "faa_mode")
  |> last()

panels.title: FAA Mode Indicator (GPVTG)
